meanings.definition: The process of adding hydrogen to a substance, typically a fat or oil, to make it solid at room temperature.
meanings.sent1: The hydrogenation of oils is used to create spreads like margarine.
meanings.sent2: Food companies often use hydrogenation to make products like shortening.
meanings.sent3: I tried to speed up the hydrogenation of my butter by putting it in the sun!
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to health led her to avoid foods that underwent hydrogenation.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen smelled of hydrogenation as the chef prepared the special recipe.

meanings.definition: The act of treating with hydrogen or subjecting to hydrogenation.
meanings.sent1: The hydrogenation of the metal made it more resistant to corrosion.
meanings.sent2: Chemists study the effects of hydrogenation on different materials.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's failed experiment resulted in an unexpected hydrogenation of the compound.
meanings.sent4: The artist's unique style was a hydrogenation of traditional techniques.
meanings.sent5: The hydrogenation of the fabric gave it a shiny, new appearance.
